title: Superuco 2013 Calcáreo Coluvio de Altamira Malbec (San Carlos)
description: Fresh berry and grapy aromas include hints of violet, Graham Cracker and crème de cassis liqueur. In the mouth, this Malbec from the southern reaches of the Uco Valley feels scratchy, with drying tannins. Lightly herbal, floral blueberry and plum flavors are not what you find every day with Malbec, while the finish is grapy but also shows juicy, wiry acidity. Drink through 2021.

title: Pegasus Estate 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Deep blackberry syrup, chipped slate and sharp black-plum skins show on the nose of this bottling. The tannins are very chalky and a bit overwhelming on the palate at first, but then open to reveal zesty but dense blackberry fruit and a touch of peppercorn. A solid choice now, it will be even better in a couple years.

title: Quinta do Vale Bragão 2013 Reserva Red (Douro)
description: This wine is young, with firm tannins and structured tannins. It has a solid character, with spice from the wood aging and a dark, bold character. Drink this powerful, concentrated wine from 2019.

title: J. Scott Cellars 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Southern Oregon)
description: With its vinicultural eye on New Zealand, this full-bodied and rich wine offers a mouth-filling mix of citrus and tropical fruits. It's lush and forward, dense with fruit and highlighted with lemon verbena. The overall effect is like sipping on a vinous lemon-drop cocktail. Quite delicious!

title: Kilikanoon 2013 Killerman's Run Cabernet Sauvignon (Clare Valley)
description: Winemaker Kevin Mitchell has been gradually refining his style, pulling back on alcohol and oak without sacrificing fruit intensity. This is a fruit-driven Cabernet, loaded with black cherries and cassis and supported by restrained, just-right oak levels. It's medium-bodied, softly dusty yet firm, with a surprisingly long finish. Drink now–2025.

title: Les Frères Perroud 2014 Améthyste  (Brouilly)
description: A two-acre parcel of 75-year-old vines is the source of this jewel of a wine. It is ripe, full bodied and packed with dark fruits. The tannins and the structure promise some aging. Concentrated from the old vines and with a mineral, tight texture, the wine will take its time to be ready. Drink from 2018.

title: M2 2014 Duality Red (Amador County)
description: Turbo-charged fruit flavors, full body and an almost thick texture make this wine opulent and compelling. While technically dry, it has such ripe blackberry and boysenberry flavors that it tastes like a syrup, coating the sides of the mouth with fruit flavor and powering to a lingering finish.

title: El Hijo 2013 Prodigo Gran Cosecha Malbec (La Consulta)
description: Ripe bold cassis and blackberry aromas come with notes of fine oak and chocolate. This is thorough and saturated on the palate, with a mix of firm tannins and cushion. Blackened plum and berry flavors have a cola accent, while this is dry, toasty and displays tannic grip on the finish; drink through 2022.

title: Donkey & Goat 2015 Ramato Filigreen Farm Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)
description: A vivid peach color telegraphs that this is not your ordinary Pinot Gris. The wine smells like peach skin and prosciutto, and is light bodied but steeped in exotic flavors of dried flowers, apricot and sea salt. It has a firm mouthfeel, noticeable astringency and an almost meaty character. It's not for the faint of heart, but fascinating.

title: Roco 2014 Private Stash #12 Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Sourced from the Wits' End (estate) vineyard, this is not noticeably different from that designated cuvée. Not that that's a bad thing—the lively raspberry and strawberry fruit flavors (laced with highlights of orange peel) are consistent and crisply defined. There's a light touch of caramel running down the finish.

title: Reichsgraf von Kesselstatt 2015 Wiltinger Trocken Riesling (Mosel)
description: A whiff of pine frond lends an invigorating alpine air to this lean, refreshingly mineral dry Riesling. The palate is crisp and cutting, bursting with fresh lime, gooseberry and quince flavors. Zesty acidity draws out a long, piercing finish. Drink now through 2020.

title: Mas d'en Gil 2010 Coma Vella Red (Priorat)
description: Gritty, spicy, schisty berry aromas are composed, while this Garnacha-led blend feels saturated and layered. Spicy plum, herbal notes and black pepper make up the flavor profile, while this is strapping, peppery tasting and complex on the finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Nervi 2009 Molsino  (Gattinara)
description: Aromas of underbrush, mature berry, new leather, blue flower and menthol emerge in the glass. On the firmly structured palate, an intense mineral vein of iron underscores dried black cherry, white pepper, dried sage and star anise. Austere fine-grained tannins provide the taut framework.

title: Nickel & Nickel 2013 Element 28 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Named for nickel's number on the periodic table, this hillside vineyard site is located across Lake Hennessey on the eastern edge of the valley. Entirely varietal, it offers juicy layers highlighted in cedar, mountain sage and mellowed chocolate. The oak and tannin are well integrated and deeply embedded, providing support and structure.

title: Robert Oatley 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Margaret River)
description: This is a terrific value in supple, ready-to-drink Cabernet. The nose is open and fragrant, offering hints of cherry and cassis, while the palate delivers bright fruit flavors spiced with cinnamon, clove and mocha. This elegant wine should continue to drink well through 2025.

title: Pascal Aufranc 2014 Probus  (Juliénas)
description: This is a structured and still firm wine. It has black fruits, some solid tannins and concentration. The acidity and the tight mineral texture both indicate an aging potential. The wine is named after the Roman emperor, Probus, who brought the Gamay grape to Beaujolais. Drink from 2018.

title: Patrick Tranchand 2014 Roche Grès  (Moulin-à-Vent)
description: The vineyard lies within sight of the Mâcon region of southern Burgundy on granite soil. This is a powerful, structured wine with strong minerality as well as acidity. It is a wine for aging, its bright red fruits and acidity needing time. Drink from 2018.

title: Prager NV Noble Companion 10-Year-Old Tawny Port (Napa Valley)
description: This is a semi-dry fortification of Cabernet Sauvignon bottled in 2015. Intense in baked plum and dried cherry, it delivers in style and balance, with full, luxurious layers of Christmas spice, gingerbread and dark chocolate.

title: Proprietà Sperino 2015 Rosa del Rosa Rosato (Piemonte)
description: Made with Nebbiolo and 15% Vespolina, this outstanding, structured rosato has delicate scents of red berry, violet and a whiff of herb. The fresh savory palate delivers sour cherry, cranberry, white pepper and cinnamon framed in an intense mineral vein. It closes on a note of mouth-watering salinity.

title: Hall 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: A woody, toasted note speaks to well-integrated yet present oak in this white that maintains medium-bodied texture on the palate. Bright, lemony acidity complements the creaminess, dashing in wet stone and undeniable floral notes of apple and orange blossom.

title: Jason-Stephens 2012 Estate Syrah (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Aromas of seared beef, black pepper, Indian spice, dried violets and dense blueberry show on the nose of this estate bottling. The palate is expertly integrated, with asphalt and tar touches alongside peppercorn, elderberry and other black fruits.

title: Sordo 2012 Monvigliero  (Barolo)
description: Leather, mature dark-skinned berry, clove and star anise aromas lead into the velvety, surprisingly approachable palate. Solid but rounded tannins uphold the juicy flavors. Drink through 2022.

title: Lafond 2012 Lafond Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's a strong plum character to the nose of this bottling, along with fresh lavender, grape candy, potpourri, cola and mint. Tart black-plum-skin flavors meet with black licorice on the sip, where richer blackberry and olallieberry fruits combine with a purple florality.

title: Lancaster 2013 Sophia's Hillside Cuvée Red (Alexander Valley)
description: From the producer's younger hillside blocks, this is comprised of 93% Cabernet Sauvignon with smaller percents of Malbec and Merlot. Blackberry and cherry are warmly wrapped in a blanket of chocolate and clove, while easy acidity provides softness and approachability to the texture and body weight, which are voluptuous.

title: Laurent Gauthier 2015 Grand Cras  (Morgon)
description: Volcanic ash over granite gives this vineyard its structured character, which carries over into this wine. Wood aged in large barrels, it has a rich firm character that will allow the wine to develop. Powered by acidity and tannins, the ripe black fruits are juicy and concentrated. Drink this wine from 2018.

title: Howard Park 2013 Miamup Cabernet Sauvignon (Margaret River)
description: Appropriately restrained and even a bit austere, this is a firm, dusty-textured Cabernet. Vanilla, tobacco and cherry notes start things off and extend through the long finish. It offers at least a decade of aging potential at a very reasonable price. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Lioco 2014 Demuth Vineyard Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)
description: This taut young wine needs time to show more personality. An aroma like fresh-baked bread and lightly toasted almonds leads to a firm mouthfeel and tight flavors like crisp green apples and peach skin. All this should soften and open up later, so drink after 2018.

title: Schloss Vollrads 2015 Semi Dry Kabinett Riesling (Rheingau)
description: Zesty lemon and lime acidity takes center stage in this invigorating medium-dry kabinett. It's leaner and more linear than the producer's regular-label kabinett, but offers loads of cutting white grapefruit and red apple flavors. The finish is refreshing and penetrating, lingering on a note of sugar cookie.

title: Silvara 2013 Meritage (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A blend of fruit from top sites DuBrul, Kiona, Dionysus, Echo Ridge and Weinbau, this wine shows subdued aromas of coffee, herb and cherry. The cranberry and cherry flavors are well proportioned, bringing a pleasing mouthfeel and a tart finish.

title: Tikal 2014 Jubilo Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon (Uco Valley)
description: This Malbec and Cabernet Sauvignon blend opens with blueberry and currant aromas that hint at the exotic. A flush racy palate is high in acid and a touch abrasive. Plum and currant flavors are not what you'd call cushioned, while this ends with hard edgy tannins and a reprise of scouring acidity. In terms of aging, this will last a long time. Drink through 2027.
